items.title: Busch increases the most in new measurement – ​​keys in on Åkesson
items.summary:
In the survey for February 2026, Magdalena Andersson (S) continued to have the highest level of trust with 43 percent. Ulf Kristersson (M) follows with 36 percent, then Jimmie Åkesson (SD) on 29 percent and Ebba Busch (KD) on 28 percent.  The distance between Andersson and Kristersson is still statistically secure - but is shrinking compared to January. Confidence in Kristersson increases somewhat and he is now statistically assured ahead of Åkesson.  Ebba Busch increases the most The largest increase is accounted for by Ebba Busch. Her confidence rises statistically by 4 percentage points, from 24 to 28 percent, which means that she is now only one percentage point behind Åkesson. 
 
In the bottom segment, a slight rise can be seen for Elisabeth Thand Ringqvist (C) and Simona Mohamsson (L), who both increase by 2 percentage points. Mistrust is changing In the same survey, mistrust towards Ulf Kristersson drops significantly by 6 percentage points, from 46 to 40 percent. Distrust of Jimmie Åkesson increases by 5 percentage points, from 54 to 59 percent. 

For Elisabeth Thand Ringqvist, mistrust increases by 5 percentage points, from 35 to 40 percent, even though trust is rising at the same time. 

Novus also points to the fact that Ebba Busch received a lot of international attention, including in Davos and in connection with a Gripen campaign in Canada. At the same time, the Christian Democrats lost in Novus' latest voter barometer and ended up under the Riksdag barrier.
items.title_original: Busch ökar mest i ny mätning – knappar in på Åkesson
items.summary_original:
I mätningen för februari 2026 har Magdalena Andersson (S) fortsatt högst förtroende med 43 procent. Ulf Kristersson (M) följer med 36 procent, därefter Jimmie Åkesson (SD) på 29 procent och Ebba Busch (KD) på 28 procent.  Avståndet mellan Andersson och Kristersson är fortfarande statistiskt säkerställt – men krymper jämfört med januari. Förtroendet för Kristersson ökar något och han är nu statistiskt säkerställt före Åkesson.  Ebba Busch ökar mest  Den största ökningen står Ebba Busch för. Hennes förtroende stiger statistiskt säkerställt med 4 procentenheter, från 24 till 28 procent, vilket gör att hon nu bara är en procentenhet efter Åkesson. 
 
I bottensegmentet syns en svag uppgång för Elisabeth Thand Ringqvist (C) och Simona Mohamsson (L), som båda ökar med 2 procentenheter. Misstroendet förändras  I samma mätning minskar misstroendet mot Ulf Kristersson markant med 6 procentenheter, från 46 till 40 procent. Misstroendet mot Jimmie Åkesson ökar med 5 procentenheter, från 54 till 59 procent. 

För Elisabeth Thand Ringqvist ökar misstroendet med 5 procentenheter, från 35 till 40 procent, trots att förtroendet samtidigt stiger. 

Novus pekar också på att Ebba Busch fått stor internationell uppmärksamhet, bland annat i Davos och i samband med en Gripen-kampanj i Kanada. Samtidigt tappade Kristdemokraterna i Novus senaste väljarbarometer och hamnade under riksdagsspärren.

items.title: Climate activist interrupted performance at Dramaten
items.summary: The activist group Restore Wetlands has taken on the action. It was during the performance "Rage" that the woman stormed the stage. She shouted something about "the culture is toothless if we don't act", says Lena Törner, press officer at Dramaten, to Expressen. The woman must have left the venue on her own and after a short break the performance could resume.
items.title_original: Klimataktivist avbröt föreställning på Dramaten
items.summary_original: Aktivistgruppen Återställ våtmarker har tagit på sig aktionen. Det var under föreställningen ”Rage” som kvinnan stormade scenen. Hon skrek någonting om att ”kulturen är tandlös om vi inte agerar”, säger Lena Törner, pressansvarig på Dramaten, till Expressen. Kvinnan ska självmant ha lämnat lokalen och efter en kort paus kunde föreställningen återupptas.

items.title: Business life: Expulsions create "brain drain"
items.summary: When children of labor immigrants are threatened with deportation, important skills that have applied to Sweden run the risk of moving elsewhere. "If the government does not stop the expulsion of teenagers now, there is a risk of a 'brain drain'", writes Teknikföretagen and Sveriges Ingenjörer in a debate article.
items.title_original: Näringslivet: Utvisningarna skapar ”brain drain”
items.summary_original: När barn till arbetskraftsinvandrare hotas av utvisning riskerar viktig kompetens som sökt sig till Sverige att dra någon annanstans. ”Om inte regeringen stoppar tonårsutvisningarna nu så riskeras en ”brain drain””, skriver Teknikföretagen och Sveriges Ingenjörer i en debattartikel.

items.title: Sweden’s AI Strategy in five minutes
items.summary: Sweden’s AI Strategy sets the long-term direction of the Government’s work with AI. It also provides guidance for work with AI throughout Sweden. The Government adopted the Strategy in February 2026.
items.title_original: Sweden’s AI Strategy in five minutes
items.summary_original: Sweden’s AI Strategy sets the long-term direction of the Government’s work with AI. It also provides guidance for work with AI throughout Sweden. The Government adopted the Strategy in February 2026.

items.title: Sweden’s first comprehensive AI strategy aims for top-10 ranking
items.summary: Sweden aims to take a leading role in artificial intelligence. The Government is now presenting a new AI strategy with the aim of providing more effective government agencies, clearer rules for businesses and better conditions for research. The objective is for Sweden to be among the world’s top 10 countries in the field of AI.

items.title: Joint Statement of the Leaders of Ukraine and the Nordic Baltic States (NB8) to mark four years of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine 24 February 2026
items.summary: Gathered in Kyiv – President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy and the leaders of the Nordic Baltic States (NB8) – Prime Minister of Estonia Kristen Michal, Prime Minister of Denmark Mette Frederiksen, President of Finland Alexander Stubb, Prime Minister of Iceland Kristrún Frostadóttir, Prime Minister of Latvia Evika Siliņa, President of Lithuania Gitanas Nausėda, Prime Minister of Norway Jonas Gahr Støre and Prime Minister of Sweden Ulf Kristersson – mark four years since Russia launched its illegal, unjustified full-scale military invasion of Ukraine.

items.title: Egypt visit characterised by impactful meetings and deepened cooperation
items.summary: For several intensive February days in Cairo, Minister for Health Care Elisabet Lann met with organisers and actors that care for severely injured patients from Gaza on a daily basis. The trip provided a deeper understanding of the extensive work being done and how Swedish initiatives are contributing.

items.title: Government intends to propose Swedish loan guarantee to World Bank to enable SEK 2.5 billion in new budget support to Ukraine
items.summary: The Government intends to enable a loan of an additional SEK 2.5 billion to Ukraine via the World Bank by guaranteeing repayment of the loan. This means that Sweden will enable additional budget support to Ukraine in early 2026.

items.title: Ebba Busch to take part in high-level AI meeting in India
items.summary: On 18–20 February, Deputy Prime Minister Ebba Busch will be in New Delhi to take part in the AI Impact Summit. The Summit gathers leaders from more than 30 countries and aims to promote international cooperation in the area of AI.

items.title: Support to Ukraine, security policy cooperation and gender equality in focus for this year’s Statement of Foreign Policy
items.summary: Today, 18 February, Minister for Foreign Affairs Maria Malmer Stenergard presented the Government’s 2026 Statement of Foreign Policy in the Riksdag. The Government’s foremost foreign policy priorities are support to Ukraine and increased pressure on Russia, stronger cooperation in security and trade, and gender equality and women’s empowerment.

items.title: New strategy for reform cooperation with Eastern Europe, the Western Balkans and Türkiye
items.summary: The Government has adopted a new strategy for Sweden’s reform cooperation with Eastern Europe, the Western Balkans and Türkiye for 2026–2030. The aim of the strategy is to strengthen the countries’ reform efforts and bring them closer to the EU.

items.title: Sweden and Ukraine agree to cooperate on cybersecurity
items.summary: Cyber attacks are one of the tactics used by Russia in its war against Ukraine. Sweden and Ukraine have now reached an agreement aimed at strengthening Ukraine’s resilience to cyber attacks, which also enhances Sweden’s capability to cope with sophisticated cyber threats.

items.title: Increased support for social and medical reforms in Ukraine
items.summary: Sweden’s support to Ukraine makes a difference. The Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida) has approved increased funding for the National Board of Health and Welfare’s programme for expanded support to Ukraine for health and medical care, care of older people and children.
